Definition: Splits a problem into smaller problems to find the solution (i.e. merge sort, binary search etc.)

Substitution method: Guess the form of the solution

Recursion trees: A tree where each node represents the cost of solving a single subproblem.
Summing all the nodes gives the total cost of the recursion

Master method.Definition: Provides an approach to solving recurrences of the form T(n)=aT(n/b)+f(n). Where a â‰¥ 1, b > 1 and f (n) is an asymptotically positive function.
Master method._note: Explain the master method more in depth
